input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SWISS FEDERAL RAILWAYS SBB PASSENGER SERVICES PRODUCTION. Summary: Procurement Project for 'High-Speed Trains' - Operating Lease. Description: SBB AG aims to procure up to 40 multi-current high-speed trains for international passenger services under an operating lease in accordance with the definition of finance leasing as stipulated in Swiss GAAP FER 13 Leases-. The vehicles are to be used in Switzerland, France, Italy, Spain, England (London), Belgium and the Netherlands. This invitation to tender contains the required lease agreement with a basic term of 15 years. In addition, the procurement includes options as detailed below. In parallel with the invitation to tender for the operating lease agreement, SBB AG will be conducting an invitation to tender for a purchase agreement for up to 40 vehicles in the basic order quantity and a service agreement for their maintenance over a period of 15 years. This procedure is scheduled to begin in the second quarter of 2026. Following the award of the contract to the rolling stock manufacturer, the purchase agreement for the basic order quantity of up to 40 vehicles is intended to be transferred to the lessor. All option rights and the maintenance service agreement will remain with SBB AG and will not be transferred to the lessor. <br> Doc Title: Procurement Project for 'High-Speed Trains' - Operating Lease <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-08-28. Closing Date: 2025-09-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: AARGAU VERKEHR AG (AVA) / LIMMAT BUS AG / BUSBETRIEB AARAU AG. Summary: Collective Sick Leave Insurance According to Vvg Aargau Verkehr Ag (ava). Description: The daily daily allowance of the three companies: - Aargau Verkehr AG (AVA) - Limmat Bus AG (Libu) - Busbetrieb Aarau AG (BBA) The AVA and LIBU have the same owners because the Libu is the 100%subsidiary of the AVA . With the BBA, the AVA has an agreement to conduct finance and human resources from the BBA. AVA and Libu are not involved in the BBA. The BBA is not involved in AVA or Libu. AVA acts as a procurement site. The three companies are said to receive individual daily daily payments, which are placed with the same insurer, are considered a risk community, but have a risk and damage-friendly premium distribution with separate premium factors.. Published Date: 2024-06-13. Closing Date: 2024-08-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: AARGAU VERKEHR AG (AVA) / LIMMAT BUS AG / BUSBETRIEB AARAU AG
output.Summary: Collective Sick Leave Insurance According to Vvg Aargau Verkehr Ag (ava)
output.Description: The daily daily allowance of the three companies: - Aargau Verkehr AG (AVA) - Limmat Bus AG (Libu) - Busbetrieb Aarau AG (BBA) The AVA and LIBU have the same owners because the Libu is the 100%subsidiary of the AVA . With the BBA, the AVA has an agreement to conduct finance and human resources from the BBA. AVA and Libu are not involved in the BBA. The BBA is not involved in AVA or Libu. AVA acts as a procurement site. The three companies are said to receive individual daily daily payments, which are placed with the same insurer, are considered a risk community, but have a risk and damage-friendly premium distribution with separate premium factors.

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: BERNMOBIL. Summary: Procurement of Payment Services for the Maas Platform. Bernmobil Municipal Transport Company Bern (svb). Description: The cities of Zurich, Bern and Basel as well as the transport companies Zurich, Bernmobil and Basel transport companies have teamed up as part of a city cooperation in order to jointly procure a mobility-as-a service (MAAS) solution for the cities involved. The city partners also strive for a common fire for the Maas app and for the mobility hubs, with the aim of combining the digital app world with the physical world of mobility hubs. Based on the contractual agreement within the city cooperation, the partners obtain an MAAS solution (app and platform). Representing the city cooperation, Bernmobil is looking for a payment service provider as part of this tender that handles the payments for the platform.. Published Date: 2024-03-07. Closing Date: 2024-07-01. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Procurement of Payment Services for the Maas Platform. Bernmobil Municipal Transport Company Bern (svb)
output.Description: The cities of Zurich, Bern and Basel as well as the transport companies Zurich, Bernmobil and Basel transport companies have teamed up as part of a city cooperation in order to jointly procure a mobility-as-a service (MAAS) solution for the cities involved. The city partners also strive for a common fire for the Maas app and for the mobility hubs, with the aim of combining the digital app world with the physical world of mobility hubs. Based on the contractual agreement within the city cooperation, the partners obtain an MAAS solution (app and platform). Representing the city cooperation, Bernmobil is looking for a payment service provider as part of this tender that handles the payments for the platform.

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SELF -ORGACK. Summary: Performing a Zero Based Budgeting at Sva Aargau Sva Aargau. Description: The SVA Aargau has set up its financial planning in the form of a budget with a medium -term finance plan as a four -year planning (budget = subsequent year, MFP = subsequent years 2.3,4). The previous rolling planning has proven to be incomprehensible, since the actual costs have regularly fallen below the budgeted costs in recent years. In addition, the job plan is only used as a reactive instrument (reporting) today. For this reason, SVA Aargau wants to carry out a zero -based budgeting with primary focus on personnel costs. The goal is to receive resilient, resilient job plan for the budget 2025 with job profiles and cost -effective KPI-s, and to model the following years in the MFP.. Published Date: 2023-10-23. Closing Date: 2023-11-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Performing a Zero Based Budgeting at Sva Aargau Sva Aargau
output.Description: The SVA Aargau has set up its financial planning in the form of a budget with a medium -term finance plan as a four -year planning (budget = subsequent year, MFP = subsequent years 2.3,4). The previous rolling planning has proven to be incomprehensible, since the actual costs have regularly fallen below the budgeted costs in recent years. In addition, the job plan is only used as a reactive instrument (reporting) today. For this reason, SVA Aargau wants to carry out a zero -based budgeting with primary focus on personnel costs. The goal is to receive resilient, resilient job plan for the budget 2025 with job profiles and cost -effective KPI-s, and to model the following years in the MFP.

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF MORGES. Summary: Full Contract for the Transformation of the Rink of Mineral Waters in Morges. Irbis Consulting Sa. Description: The market put into submission relates to the provision of the equipment according to the level of comfort desired by the city of Morges and allowing the reception of user. It will include funding, studies with a view to establishing the building permit (since phase 31), its removal and carrying out the work necessary for the operation of the building and the reception of the public according to the Requirements of the city of Morges to respond to the minimum to the energy strategy of the city of Morges. It also includes a commitment on an energy consumption of the ice rink throughout the duration of the contract, as well as maintenance and possibly large maintenance and Renewal (Ger) of technical installations. The city will retain the daily management of the installation and its current maintenance.. Published Date: 2023-09-08. Closing Date: 2023-10-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Full Contract for the Transformation of the Rink of Mineral Waters in Morges. Irbis Consulting Sa

It will include funding, studies with a view to establishing the building permit (since phase 31), its removal and carrying out the work necessary for the operation of the building and the reception of the public according to the Requirements of the city of Morges to respond to the minimum to the energy strategy of the city of Morges. It also includes a commitment on an energy consumption of the ice rink throughout the duration of the contract, as well as maintenance and possibly large maintenance and Renewal (Ger) of technical installations. The city will retain the daily management of the installation and its current maintenance.

The pool of existing devices must continue to be used until the devices are replaced . All the new devices to be acquired must be leased. Leasing is therefore done in the spot.
